parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
An ox, cow, bull. Probably from the base of bosko; an ox, i.e. An animal of that species.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A pit, well, cistern. Of uncertain derivation; a hole in the ground, i.e. A cistern or well; figuratively, an abyss.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To drag up, pull up, draw up, draw out. From ana and spao; to take up or extricate.
